intro: Elattostachys palauensis, commonly known as the Palau stiltgrass, is a flowering plant native to the island of Palau in the Western Pacific. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, lowland areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Elattostachys palauensis has small, inconspicuous flowers that are arranged in spikelets, and it plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
